facts.text: Sporting Kansas City began play in Major League Soccer (MLS) in 1996 as the Kansas City Wiz.
The team was founded by Lamar Hunt in 1995.
Sporting Kansas City was originally named Kansas City Wiz in 1996 before changing to Kansas City Wizards in 1997.
The team rebranded to Sporting Kansas City in November 2010.
Sporting Kansas City has won the MLS Cup in 2000 and 2013.
Sporting Kansas City won the Supporters' Shield in 2000.
Sporting Kansas City has won the U.S. Open Cup in 2004, 2012, 2015, and 2017.
Sporting Kansas City's reserve team, Sporting Kansas City II, began play in the USL Championship in 2016 before switching to MLS Next Pro in 2022.
The Kansas City Wiz played their first game on April 13, 1996, defeating the Colorado Rapids with a score of 3–0.
Preki was named the MLS MVP in 1997.
Tony Meola set an MLS record with a shutout streak of 681 minutes and won the MLS Goalkeeper of the Year and MLS MVP in 2000.
Peter Vermes was named the 2000 MLS Defender of the Year.
Sporting Kansas City won the MLS Supporters' Shield in 2000 with a regular-season record of 16–7–9.
Sporting Kansas City won their first MLS Cup in 2000, defeating the Chicago Fire with an 11th-minute goal by Miklos Molnar.
Tony Meola was named the 2000 MLS Cup MVP.
In 2001, the Kansas City Wizards were eliminated from the playoffs by the Miami Fusion with a score of 6 points to 3.
The Kansas City Wizards finished the 2002 MLS season in last place in the Western Conference but still made the playoffs.
Landon Donovan scored a golden goal in the 117th minute for the San Jose Earthquakes against the Kansas City Wizards in the 2003 MLS playoffs.
The Kansas City Wizards won the Western Conference regular season championship in 2004 with a record of 14–9–9.
Josh Wolff scored the first penalty kick in MLS Cup history during the 2004 MLS Cup final.
The Kansas City Wizards moved to the Eastern Conference in 2005 following MLS expansion.
In 2006, the Kansas City Wizards missed out on a playoff berth with a loss to the New York Red Bulls on the final day of the regular season.
Lamar Hunt sold the Kansas City Wizards to OnGoal, LLC in August 2006.
The Kansas City Wizards dedicated their 2007 season to Lamar Hunt, who died in December 2006.
Kansas City Wizards finished fifth in the Eastern Conference in 2007 with a record of 11–12–7 and qualified for the playoffs.
As of August 2017, Sporting Kansas City had over 100 straight sellouts for their matches.
Sporting Kansas City has 14,000 season-ticket holders.
The average age of Sporting Kansas City season-ticket holders is 29.7 years.
The main supporters group of Sporting Kansas City is known as "The Cauldron".
"Blue the Dog" is the official mascot of Sporting Kansas City.
As of 2022, Sporting Kansas City's record against the Houston Dynamo was 18–18–16 (W–L–T).
The Portland Thorns defeated the Kansas City Current 2–0 in the 2022 NWSL Championship.
Sporting Kansas City began a rivalry with St. Louis City SC starting with the 2023 season.
St. Louis City won the first meeting against Sporting Kansas City at CityPark in May 2023.
Sporting Kansas City won their first postseason matchup against St. Louis City SC in the 2023 MLS Cup playoffs.
From 2023, every Sporting Kansas City match is available via MLS Season Pass on the Apple TV app.
Nate Bukaty began broadcasting for Sporting Kansas City in the 2015 season.
Andy Gruenebaum provided color commentary for Sporting Kansas City following his retirement after the 2014 season.
Sporting Kansas City's matches were broadcast on KMCI-TV in high definition prior to 2017.
Sporting Kansas City Television Network's coverage extended across six states including Kansas, Missouri, Iowa, Nebraska, Oklahoma, and Arkansas.
Fox Sports Kansas City became the broadcaster for Sporting Kansas City matches not broadcast nationally, with the change occurring in 2017.
Jacob Peterson joined as the color commentator for Sporting Kansas City ahead of the 2020 season.
KMCI returned as the broadcast partner for Sporting Kansas City in the Kansas City market in 2022.
Spanish radio broadcasts for Sporting Kansas City moved to KCZZ (ESPN Deportes Kansas City 1480AM) for the 2018 season.
Sporting Kansas City won the MLS Fair Play Award in 1998, 2002, 2005, and 2006.
Sporting Kansas City won the CONCACAF Champions League Fair Play Award in 2019.
Graham Zusi holds the record for the most MLS regular season games played for Sporting Kansas City with 355 games.
Preki is the top goalscorer in MLS regular season for Sporting Kansas City with 71 goals.
Dániel Sallói holds the record for the most match-winning goals in MLS regular season for Sporting Kansas City with 17.
Preki also holds the record for the most assists in MLS regular season for Sporting Kansas City with 98 assists.
Tim Melia has the most wins for Sporting Kansas City in MLS regular season with 73 wins.
Tim Melia also holds the record for the most shutouts in MLS regular season for Sporting Kansas City with 52 shutouts.
Tim Melia has made the most saves in MLS regular season for Sporting Kansas City with 530 saves.
Roger Espinoza has the most ejections in MLS regular season for Sporting Kansas City with 11 ejections.
The Sporting Legends initiative was launched by Sporting Kansas City in 2013 to honor individuals significant to the club and soccer's growth in the region.

Sporting Kansas City rebranded from Kansas City Wizards on November 17, 2010.
Preki was named the MLS MVP in 2003.
Sporting Kansas City beat Manchester United at Arrowhead Stadium on July 25, 2010.
A record crowd watched Manchester United play in Kansas City on July 25, 2010.
Sporting Kansas City played their home games at Arrowhead Stadium from 1996 to 2007.
Sporting Kansas City's home venue changed to Children's Mercy Park in 2011 and has remained there since.
Peter Vermes became the head coach of Sporting Kansas City in 2009.
The Kansas City Wizards, the former name for Sporting Kansas City, won the MLS Cup in 2000.
Columbus Crew won the MLS Cup in 2020.
The New York Red Bulls won the Supporters' Shield in 2024.
The first team to win the MLS Cup was D.C. United in 1996.
Chivas USA was an MLS team from 2005 to 2014 before ceasing operations.
